meaning: a round fruit with red or green skin and a whitish interior
when_to_say: When referring to the fruit or using it in idiomatic expressions.
example: She ate an apple for lunch.

meaning: to move at a speed faster than a walk
when_to_say: When describing the action of moving quickly on foot.
example: He likes to run in the park every morning.

meaning: feeling or showing pleasure or contentment
when_to_say: When expressing feelings of joy or satisfaction.
example: She felt happy when she received the good news.

meaning: a set of written, printed, or blank pages fastened together along one side and encased between protective covers
when_to_say: When referring to a physical or digital collection of written content.
example: He borrowed a book from the library.

meaning: to gain knowledge or skill by study or experience
when_to_say: When talking about acquiring knowledge or skills.
example: I want to learn how to play the guitar.
